Hi, I am a bot that will assist you with showing 
COVID-19 data, including, 
What is covid? 
How covid is being transmitted amongst individuals 
Safeguards to be taken 
Symptoms etc. 
Thank you!!!! 
Happy to help!!!!

Greetings, I am a chatbot designed to help you 
with precise information about Covid crisis around globe 
and considerably more. 
I will be happy to answer your questions and 
assist you by giving definite data. 
Thank you!!!!

A novel coronavirus is a new coronavirus 
that has not been previously identified. 
The virus causing coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19), 
is not the same as the coronaviruses that commonly 
circulate among humans and cause mild illness, 
like the common cold.

Coronaviruses are a type of virus. 
There are many different kinds, and some cause 
disease. A newly identified coronavirus, SARS-CoV-
2, has caused a worldwide pandemic of respiratory 
illness, called COVID-19.

patterns: measures to be taken to avoid corona
What precautions should be taken for corona
what precautionary measures ought to be taken for corona
How can one avoid catching or spreading Coronavirus?
What can I do to protect myself and prevent the spread of disease?
How do I protect myself and others from covid 19 infection?
How do I protect myself if I have been around someone who is infected with covid 19?
How do I keep safe from COVID-19?
responses:
Wash your hands with soap and water thoroughly. 

Continuously wash your hands when you return home 
or from work. 

Use hand sanitizer gel if soap and water 
are not accessible. 

Cover your mouth and nose with face 
masks. 

Attempt to stay away from close contact with 
individuals who are unwell. 

Try not to touch your eyes, nose or 
mouth if your hands are not clean.

Wear a mask to protect yourself and others 
and stop the spread of COVID-19. 

Stay at least 6 feet (about 2 arm lengths) from 
others who donâ€™t live with you. 

Avoid crowds. 

Wash your hands often. 

Monitor your health daily. 

Get vaccinated to protect against COVID-19.

patterns: What are the symptoms of novel coronavirus?
What are the symptoms and complications that COVID-19 can cause?
When should I seek emergency care if I have COVID-19?
What are the symptoms of COVID-19?
What are the indications of COVID-19?
What are the indications of corona virus?
responses:
People with COVID-19 have reported a wide 
range of symptoms - from mild symptoms to 
severe illness. Symptoms may appear 2-14 
days after exposure to the virus. If you 
have fever, cough, or other symptoms, you 
might have COVID-19.

Look for emergency warning signs for 
COVID-19. If someone is showing any of 
the following signs, seek emergency medical 
care immediately: 

Trouble breathing 

Persistent pain or pressure in the chest 

New confusion 

Inability to wake or stay awake 

Bluish lips or face

A few people contaminated with the 
infection show no symptoms. 
At the point when the infection shows symptoms, 
people have fever, body pains, cough, nasal 
clog, runny nose, chills, headache and sore 
throat

patterns: How is the coronavirus disease transmitted?
Can COVID-19 be transmitted from human to human
How is the Covid infection communicated?
Can the virus that causes COVID-19 be transmitted through the air?
responses:
COVID-19 usually spreads through close contact 
(less than six feet apart), when an infected 
person transmits viral load onto others 
by coughing, sneezing or spreading virus onto 
commonly touched surfaces. 

Even asymptomatic carriers of the virus 
can spread the viral load by indirect means, 
talking, singing or being in close contact to 
people. A person can get infected if the virus 
gets inhaled, or lands in their mouth, nose, 
eyes or ears.

The virus that causes COVID-19 most 
commonly spreads between people who are 
in close contact with one another (within 
about 6 feet, or 2 arm lengths). 
It spreads through respiratory droplets or small 
particles.It is possible that COVID-19 may 
spread through the droplets and airborne particles 
that are formed when a person who has COVID-19 
coughs, sneezes, sings, talks, or breathes.

People can catch COVID-19 from others who 
have the virus. The disease can spread 
from person to person through small 
droplets from the nose or mouth which are 
spread when a person with COVID-19 coughs 
or exhales.

patterns: How long does the virus survive on surfaces?
How Long Does the Coronavirus Live on Surfaces?
How long covid 19 can live on common surfaces
responses:
Studies suggest that corona viruses 
(including preliminary information on the COVID-19 virus) 
may persist on surfaces for a few hours 
or up to several days. 
This may vary under different conditions 
(e.g. type of surface, temperature or humidity 
of the environment).

The coronavirus can live for hours to 
days on surfaces like counter tops and doorknobs. 
How long it survives depends on the material 
the surface is made from.

Research suggests the virus' lifespan 
is anywhere between three hours and three days on 
surfaces, depending on the material. 

It is found that both coronaviruses lived the 
longest on stainless steel and polypropylene 
which is a type of plastic.

patterns: Who is at increased risk for developing severe illness from covid 19?
Who is at a higher risk to get infected with COVID-19?
who is most at risk for the coronavirus disease
what groups are at higher risk of contracting covid-19
who is at higher risk for severe illness from covid-19?
responses:
People at increased risk include:

Older adults 

People of all ages with certain underlying medical 
conditions 

Pregnant people are also at increased risk for 
severe illness from COVID-19.

COVID-19 is often more severe in people 
60+yrs or with health conditions like lung 
or heart disease, diabetes or conditions that affect 
their immune system.

patterns: How long is the incubation period for COVID-19?
What is the incubation period of the coronavirus disease?
How long does it take for symptoms of the coronavirus disease to appear?
responses:
Incubation period for COVID-19 range from 
1-14 days,most commonly around five days.

On average it takes 5 to 6 days from when
 someone is infected with the virus for symptoms
 to show, however it can take up to 14 days.

patterns: How is covid 19 diagnosed and tested
How is Coronavirus analyzed and tried
What are different methods to test whether a person is having covid or no
What are various techniques to test whether an individual is having Coronavirus or no
responses:
COVID-19 can be diagnosed by laboratory test, 
polymerase chain reaction (PCR) molecular test, on 
a respiratory tract sample (e.g. sample from 
nose, throat or chest). This test detects 
the SARS-CoV-2 genetic material.

patterns: what activities were restricted in the lockdown in early stages of coronavirus breakdown?
What was lockdown like in early stages of outbreak?
How was lockdown in beginning phases of corona virus outbreak?
responses:
Lockdown restrictions: 

No assembly of people 

Places of religious worships closed 

Gyms, swimming pool and movie theatres closed 

Public transport temporarily closed

responses:
Lockdown in most parts of India has been 
lifted now, night curfews in some areas are still there. 
Please get in touch with local administration 
of your area for more details about current Lockdown 
situation.

patterns: Which vaccine is used in India for Covid 19?
Are there any vaccines or other medical products to prevent COVID-19
Is there any cure for COVID-19?
How long will it take for scientists to develop a vaccine to COVID-19?
Is there a vaccine for the coronavirus?
responses:
There are number of vaccines accessible now 
some of which are as yet in making. 
Out of those Covishield and Covaxin are the 
vaccines utilized in India.

The virus that causes COVID-19 is 
thought to spread mainly from person to person, 
mainly through respiratory droplets produced when 
an infected person coughs or sneezes.

patterns: Where can I get tested for COVID-19
responses:
Contact your state, local, tribal, or territorial 
department for more information, or reach out 
to a medical provider.

patterns: Why is a cure taking so long
responses:
An antiviral drug must be able to target the 
specific part of a virus's life cycle that 
is necessary for it to reproduce, according to 
Harvard Medical School.

patterns: How many people with coronavirus don't have symptoms
responses:
Recent studies suggest 25% to 50% of 
coronavirus carriers don't have symptoms.

patterns: How long does it take to recover
responses:
It takes anything up to six weeks to recover from 
this disease.

responses: rRT PCR test

responses: 4 weeks

patterns: What treatments are available for COVID-19
responses:
People with COVID-19 should receive supportive 
care to help relieve symptoms. People with 
mild symptoms are able to recover at home.

patterns: What is plasma therapy for covid corona virus
responses:
Convalescent plasma is the liquid part of 
blood that is collected from patients who have 
recovered from the novel coronavirus disease, COVID-19, 
caused by the virus SARS-CoV-2.

patterns: How are people tested for COVID-19
responses:
To be tested for COVID-19, a sample is 
typically collected from your nose and or 
throat with a special swab at a designated collection 
location staffed by health care professionals.

patterns: What is the source of the corona virus
responses:
Early on, many of the patients at the epicenter 
of the COVID-19 outbreak in China had some link 
to a large seafood and live animal market, 
suggesting animal-to-person spread.

patterns: What does it mean that COVID-19 is a Global Pandemic
responses:
A pandemic is a global outbreak of disease. 
Pandemics happen when a new virus emerges to 
infect people and can spread between people.

Social distancing is deliberately increasing 
the physical space between people to avoid 
spreading illness.

Right now, it appears that COVID-19, the 
disease caused by the new coronavirus, causes more 
cases of severe disease and more deaths than 
the seasonal flu. People over age 85 have 
the highest risk of fatality and children 
under 19, the lowest, but this could 
change as more people are tested and trends 
become clearer.

patterns: When will the COVID-19 virus end?
responses:
At some point, it will be over, and then 
weâ€™ll go back to normal.

patterns: How likely am I to catch COVID-19
responses:
The risk depends on where you are - 
and more specifically, whether there is 
a COVID-19 outbreak unfolding there.

patterns: How can I get tested for COVID-19
responses:
Call your local clinic medical facility to 
inform them of your condition and relevant travel 
exposure history. If you had been identified as a 
close contact of a case by the local Ministry of Health 
or WHO, please also indicate this. From here you will 
be advised if a medical assessment is necessary and how 
to get tested.

patterns: How likely am I to catch COVID-19
responses:
The risk depends on where you live or 
where you have travelled recently. The 
risk of infection is higher in areas where a number 
people have been diagnosed with COVID-19.

6. Remote Working Turning Mainstream

8. Education becomes digitized & affordable

responses:
Family and friends come first 
There's no place like the outdoors 
Prevention is power

patterns: What is the main cause of COVID-19?
responses:
COVID-19 is caused by infection with the severe 
acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 SARS-CoV-2 
virus strain.

patterns: How do I get an antibody test for COVID-19?
responses:
COVID-19 tests are available that can test 
for current infection or past infection. 
A viral test tells you if you have a current infection. 
Two types of viral tests can be used: 
nucleic acid amplification tests NAATs and 
antigen tests. 
An antibody test also known as a serology test might 
tell you if you had a past infection. Antibody tests 
should not be used to diagnose a current infection.

Many health experts believe that the 
new strain of coronavirus likely 
originated in bats or pangolins. The first transmission 
to humans was in Wuhan, China. Since then, the 
virus has mostly spread through person-to-person 
contact.
Yes
